New Records: Shubman Gill became the fifth Indian to score centuries in all three international formats.
India's margin of victory - 168 runs - was the highest in any T20I involving two Full-Member teams.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored 126* to set up the innings.
Hardik Pandya decided to bat first due to the conditions.
New Zealand's top order struggled against India's bowling attack.
Pre-Game Insights: Hardik Pandya used his experience from the IPL final to decide the batting order.
The series win extended India's unbeaten series record at home since March 2019.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill's performance was praised by analysts and fans.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment in India's cricket journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was live-streamed in the UK and USA on ESPN Player and ESPN+.
Ben Lister made his debut for New Zealand in this match.
Others: The article includes detailed commentary and statistics about the match.
